bill_title: provide for the recall of certain officials in third class municipalities.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the recall of members of the board of trustees in third class municipalities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-13-29 be amended to read as follows: 9-13-29. In municipalities of the first and second classes any municipality, with or without a city manager, the mayor or , any commissioner or , any alderman , or any member of the board of trustees may be removed from office at any time by the voters qualified to vote for his a successor as provided in §§ 9-13-30 to 9-13-32, inclusive. Section 2. That § 9-13-30 be amended to read as follows: 9-13-30. A petition signed by fifteen percent of the registered voters of the first or second class municipality, based upon the total number of registered voters at the last preceding general election, demanding the election of a successor to the mayor, commissioner, or alderman , or trustee sought to be removed shall be filed with the auditor and presented by the auditor to the governing body. The allowable grounds for removal are misconduct, malfeasance, nonfeasance, crimes in office, drunkenness, gross incompetency, corruption, theft, oppression, or gross partiality. The petition shall contain a specific statement of the grounds on which removal is sought. The form for the municipal recall petition shall be prescribed by the state Board of Elections pursuant to chapter 1-26. No signature on a petition is valid if signed more than sixty days prior to the filing of the petitions. Section 3. That § 9-13-32 be amended to read as follows: 9-13-32. Any mayor or , commissioner or , alderman , or trustee sought to be removed may be a candidate to succeed himself or herself and, unless he the incumbent requests otherwise in writing, the auditor shall place his the incumbent's name on the official ballot without nomination. The auditor shall also place on the official ballot the name of any other candidate nominated as provided in this chapter. In the case of a third class municipality, if no other candidate is nominated for the position of trustee, no recall election may be held, and the incumbent shall remain in office. Any secondary election required shall be conducted as provided by this chapter. Section 4. That § 9-13-35 be amended to read as follows: 9-13-35. The successor of any removed mayor or , commissioner or , alderman , or trustee shall hold office during the remainder of the predecessor's unexpired term of his predecessor .
